comment.body:
> may be unsafe,

We'd be able to switch to specific block if someone can continuously provide a complete list of these hundreds of malicious domain changing everyday:
```
https://www.dropbox.com/s/qtxp4xsj3h6glwi/20230627DL_199_19_95_72.txt
https://www.dropbox.com/s/bqjmjnrbo7ya0zm/20230601PH_103_114_217_10.txt
```
We told those who actually need duckdns how to disable the rule, not to mention they can still access the site with single click.

comment.body:
@zloyden Thanks for your help!

When I added the rule you listed, the site still detected adblock, and didn't let me play the game.

When I disabled all default filters (keeping the custom rule you gave), it lets me play, and several of the ads do not appear (even though the boxes in which they appear still show up). An ad showed up while waiting for other players to join, and, most importantly, a full-screen advertisement showed up for a few seconds after pressing to start playing a game.

https://i.imgur.com/i2q2m33.png

https://i.imgur.com/H7IgiJD.png

https://i.imgur.com/fFWnbQA.png

https://i.imgur.com/xfhjstW.png
